cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
"Which make of car is advertised under the slogan ""Vorsprung Durch Technik""?"
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
1. The slogan "Vorsprung Durch Technik" is a well-known phrase in the automotive industry. It is German for "Advancement Through Technology."
2. This slogan is specifically associated with a particular car manufacturer that emphasizes engineering and technological innovation in its vehicles.
3. The car manufacturer that prominently uses this slogan in its advertising campaigns is Audi.
4. Audi is recognized for its commitment to quality, performance, and advanced technology in its cars, aligning perfectly with the meaning of the slogan.

Answer:
Audi

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
"Which make of car is advertised under the slogan ""Vorsprung Durch Technik""?"
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- Vorsprung durch Technik – "competitive edge through technology", used in an advertising campaign by Audi\n', 'Audi\'s corporate tagline is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning ""Progress through Technology"". The German-language tagline is used in many European countries, including the United Kingdom, and in other markets, such as Latin America, Oceania and parts of Asia including Japan. A few years ago, the North American tagline was ""Innovation through technology"", but in Canada the German tagline "Vorsprung durch Technik" was used in advertising. Since 2007, Audi has used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" in the U.S. However, since the Audi emissions testing scandal came to light in September 2015, this slogan was lambasted for being discordant with reality. In fact, just hours after disgraced Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn admitted to cheating on emissions data, an advertisement during the 2015 Primetime Emmy Awards promoted Audi\'s latest advances in low emissions technology with Kermit the Frog stating, "It\'s not that easy being green."\n', 'From 1931 Ferdinand Porsche and Zündapp developed the type 12 prototype "Auto für Jedermann" ("car for everyone"), which was the first time the name Volkswagen was used. Porsche preferred the 4-cylinder flat engine, but Zündapp used a water-cooled 5-cylinder radial engine. In 1932 three prototypes were running. All three cars were lost during the war, the last in a 1945 Stuttgart bombing raid.\n', 'Some of the advertising slogans Subaru has used in the past include: "Inexpensive, and built to stay that way" (USA 1970s – early 1980s), "The World\'s Favourite Four Wheel Drive" (in the UK), "Plus on y pense, plus on a le goût de la conduire" (Literally: "The more one thinks, the more one has the taste (or desire, impulse, drive) of driving it") in French Quebec, "We built our reputation by building a better car", "What to Drive", "The Beauty of All-Wheel Drive", "Driven by What\'s Inside", "Think, Feel, Drive", "Love. It\'s what makes Subaru, a Subaru" (USA early 2010s) and currently "Confidence in Motion" in North America, "All 4 The Driver" in Australia, "Uncommon Engineering, Uncommon Stability, Uncommon Roadholding, Uncommon Sense" in the UK and "Technology that gives you Confidence in Motion" in Southeast Asia.\n', 'BULLET::::- Audi: Vorsprung durch Technik (Literally: Advantage through technology, Figuratively: The technical edge)\n', 'On 26 May 1938, Hitler laid the cornerstone for the Volkswagen factory in Fallersleben. He gave a speech, in which he named the car "Kraft-durch-Freude-Wagen" ("Strength Through Joy Car", usually abbreviated to "KdF-Wagen"). \n', 'The Marketing Department researched their files and retrieved for the Ford P7b a slogan coined for Bahnsen’s innovatively styled 1960 Taunus P3, „Linie der Vernunft“ which loosely translates as “rational form”. This they now applied to the P7b. Now, as ten years earlier, the intention was to point up an aesthetic contrast between a newly simplified 17M model and an over-decorated predecessor.\n', 'The 1960s was a period of rapid expansion in Europe both for the auto-industry and in the world of advertising. Ford tended to be ahead of the field in this aspect of marketing, even if some of the resulting slogans appear stilted fifty years later. The style of new Taunus 17M was advertised as representing a „Linie der Vernunft" which loosely translates as a ""rational form"" offering an implicit rebuke to the by now unfashionably elaborate styling of the old Taunus 17M. The car was advertised with the balanced and pithy slogan "Zum Fahren geboren. Zum sparen gebaut" "(Born to drive. Built to save/economise)".\n', "The 919 Hybrid was liveried in white and incorporated the 'Porsche Intelligent Performance' slogan, with the first letters of each word emblazoned down the vehicle when viewed from the top. The rear wing was liveried in black with the word 'Porsche' in red letters. The team had no title sponsor, with few sponsor stickers adorning the car. Its race number was put in a red square in the middle of the top section of its sidepods and near both fenders but below both door panels. On 12\xa0June 2013, Bernhard drove the 919 Hybrid in a one-day private test session under a camouflage livery at Porsche's Weissach test track. Testing continued into September, with car development carried out at France's Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours and Circuit Paul Ricard, Italy's Autodromo Nazionale Monza and Germany's EuroSpeedway Lausitz. Its 2013 schedule concluded at Portugal's Algarve International Circuit in December.\n", 'The company name is based on the Latin translation of the surname of the founder, August Horch. "Horch", meaning "listen" in German, becomes "audi" in Latin. The four rings of the Audi logo each represent one of four car companies that banded together to create Audi\'s predecessor company, Auto Union. Audi\'s slogan is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning "Being Ahead through Technology". However, Audi USA had used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" from 2007 to 2016, and have not used the slogan since 2016. Audi, along with fellow German marques BMW and Mercedes-Benz, is among the best-selling luxury automobile brands in the world.\n']

Task Description:
Please extract content that may be unfamiliar to the model from these passages, 
which can provide the model with relevant background and unknown knowledge and concepts, 
helping it better understand the question. and analyze the role of these contents.

To answer the question regarding which make of car is advertised under the slogan "Vorsprung Durch Technik," we can extract and analyze relevant content from the provided passages. The key pieces of information that may be unfamiliar or require clarification include:

1. **Meaning of the Slogan**: The slogan "Vorsprung Durch Technik" translates to "Advantage through technology" or "Progress through Technology." Understanding this translation is crucial as it encapsulates the brand's emphasis on innovation and technological advancement.

2. **Brand Association**: The passages explicitly state that the slogan is used by Audi. This association is critical for answering the question directly. Audi is identified as a luxury automobile brand that emphasizes engineering and technology in its marketing.

3. **Historical Context**: The passages mention that Audi's slogan has been used in various markets, including Europe, Latin America, Oceania, and parts of Asia. This context helps to understand the brand's global marketing strategy and the significance of the slogan in different cultural settings.

4. **Corporate Tagline Evolution**: The passages indicate that Audi has used different taglines in various regions, such as "Innovation through technology" in North America and "Truth in Engineering" from 2007 to 2016. This evolution reflects the brand's adaptive marketing strategies and the impact of external events, such as the emissions scandal, on its branding.

5. **Audi's Background**: The mention of Audi's history, including its founding and the significance of the four rings logo representing the merger of four car companies, provides context about the brand's heritage and its standing in the automotive industry.

### Role of Extracted Content:

- **Clarification of Terminology**: Understanding the meaning of "Vorsprung Durch Technik" helps clarify the brand's message and marketing focus, which is essential for comprehending the brand's identity.
  
- **Direct Answer to the Question**: The explicit mention of Audi as the brand associated with the slogan provides a straightforward answer to the question posed.

- **Contextual Understanding**: The historical and marketing context enhances the understanding of how Audi positions itself in the competitive automotive market, which may be relevant for further inquiries about brand strategies or consumer perceptions.

- **Cultural Relevance**: The information about the slogan's usage in various markets highlights the importance of cultural adaptation in advertising, which could be relevant for discussions about global branding strategies.

In summary, the extracted content provides a comprehensive understanding of the slogan "Vorsprung Durch Technik," its association with Audi, and the broader context of the brand's marketing and history, which is essential for accurately answering the question.

Task Description:

Engage in a dialogue where you imagine discussing these passages with a group of experts. Each expert presents different perspectives based on the foundational and advanced knowledge from the passages. Identify points of agreement and disagreement among the experts, and analyze how these differing perspectives contribute to a deeper understanding of the topic. Synthesize the insights from the discussion into a cohesive summary that captures the full range of foundational and advanced knowledge. Highlight how these perspectives expand the understanding of the question.

By participating in this collaborative discussion, you will deepen the model's understanding through the synthesis of multiple expert perspectives.

**Expert Discussion on "Vorsprung Durch Technik" and Audi**

**Expert 1: The Linguistic Perspective**
The first expert emphasizes the linguistic significance of the slogan "Vorsprung durch Technik," translating it as "Advantage through Technology" or "Being Ahead through Technology." This expert points out that the slogan encapsulates Audi's brand identity, which focuses on innovation and technological advancement. They argue that the use of a German phrase in international markets, particularly in Europe, reinforces Audi's heritage and commitment to engineering excellence.

**Expert 2: The Marketing Perspective**
The second expert takes a marketing approach, noting that "Vorsprung durch Technik" has been a cornerstone of Audi's advertising strategy since its inception. They highlight how the slogan has been adapted over time, particularly in North America, where it was replaced with "Truth in Engineering" after the emissions scandal. This expert suggests that the shift in slogans reflects a broader strategy to rebuild trust and align the brand with consumer expectations of transparency and integrity.

**Expert 3: The Historical Context**
The third expert provides historical context, discussing how Audi's slogan has evolved alongside the company's reputation. They reference the emissions scandal that tarnished Audi's image and the subsequent need for a rebranding effort. This expert argues that the original slogan's emphasis on technology became ironic in light of the scandal, leading to a necessary reevaluation of how Audi communicates its values to consumers.

**Expert 4: The Competitive Landscape**
The fourth expert discusses Audi's position within the competitive landscape of luxury automobile brands, comparing it to BMW and Mercedes-Benz. They note that while all three brands emphasize technology and performance, Audi's unique selling proposition lies in its commitment to innovation, as encapsulated by "Vorsprung durch Technik." This expert argues that the slogan not only differentiates Audi from its competitors but also aligns with consumer trends favoring advanced technology in vehicles.

**Points of Agreement**
All experts agree that "Vorsprung durch Technik" is a vital part of Audi's brand identity and marketing strategy. They recognize the slogan's role in conveying the company's commitment to technological advancement and innovation. Additionally, there is consensus on the impact of the emissions scandal on Audi's branding and the necessity for a shift in messaging to regain consumer trust.

**Points of Disagreement**
The experts diverge on the implications of the slogan's evolution. While some view the change to "Truth in Engineering" as a necessary response to a crisis, others argue that it reflects a deeper issue within the brand's identity and its relationship with consumers. There is also debate about the effectiveness of the slogan in different markets, with some experts suggesting that the German phrase resonates more strongly in Europe than in North America.

**Synthesis and Summary**
The discussion highlights the multifaceted nature of Audi's slogan "Vorsprung durch Technik." It serves not only as a marketing tool but also as a reflection of the company's engineering ethos and historical challenges. The experts' perspectives reveal the complexities of brand identity in the automotive industry, particularly in the wake of crises that challenge consumer trust. Ultimately, the slogan embodies Audi's aspiration to lead through technology while also illustrating the dynamic interplay between brand messaging and consumer perception in a competitive market. This comprehensive understanding underscores the importance of aligning brand values with consumer expectations, especially in an era where transparency and integrity are paramount.

', "The 919 Hybrid was liveried in white and incorporated the 'Porsche Intelligent Performance' slogan, with the first letters of each word emblazoned down the vehicle when viewed from the top. The rear wing was liveried in black with the word 'Porsche' in red letters. The team had no title sponsor, with few sponsor stickers adorning the car. Its race number was put in a red square in the middle of the top section of its sidepods and near both fenders but below both door panels. On 12\xa0June 2013, Bernhard drove the 919 Hybrid in a one-day private test session under a camouflage livery at Porsche's Weissach test track. Testing continued into September, with car development carried out at France's Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours and Circuit Paul Ricard, Italy's Autodromo Nazionale Monza and Germany's EuroSpeedway Lausitz. Its 2013 schedule concluded at Portugal's Algarve International Circuit in December.
", 'The company name is based on the Latin translation of the surname of the founder, August Horch. "Horch", meaning "listen" in German, becomes "audi" in Latin. The four rings of the Audi logo each represent one of four car companies that banded together to create Audi's predecessor company, Auto Union. Audi's slogan is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning "Being Ahead through Technology". However, Audi USA had used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" from 2007 to 2016, and have not used the slogan since 2016. Audi, along with fellow German marques BMW and Mercedes-Benz, is among the best-selling luxury automobile brands in the world.
']

consolidate these contents, and analyze how the selected information may impact the improvement of the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities.

To enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities, we can extract and consolidate key information from the provided passages regarding the slogan "Vorsprung Durch Technik" and its association with Audi. Here’s a breakdown of the relevant content and its implications:

### Extracted Information

1. **Slogan Meaning and Usage**:
   - "Vorsprung durch Technik" translates to "Advantage through technology" or "Progress through technology."
   - It is used as an advertising slogan by Audi, emphasizing the brand's commitment to technological advancement.

2. **Historical Context**:
   - The slogan has been employed in various markets, including Europe, Latin America, Oceania, and parts of Asia, indicating its global recognition and branding strategy.
   - Audi's previous slogan in North America was "Innovation through technology," showcasing a shift in marketing strategy over time.

3. **Brand Identity**:
   - Audi is positioned as a luxury automobile brand, competing with other high-end brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz.
   - The slogan reflects Audi's identity as a leader in engineering and technology within the automotive industry.

4. **Corporate Messaging**:
   - The slogan has been subject to scrutiny, especially following the emissions testing scandal, which highlights the importance of aligning corporate messaging with actual practices and innovations.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference

1. **Understanding Brand Positioning**:
   - By analyzing how Audi uses "Vorsprung durch Technik," the model can learn to infer the relationship between branding strategies and consumer perceptions. This understanding can enhance the model's ability to reason about how slogans influence brand identity and market positioning.

2. **Causal Relationships**:
   - The model can explore causal relationships, such as how technological advancements lead to competitive advantages in the automotive industry. This can help in making logical inferences about the impact of innovation on market success.

3. **Evaluating Corporate Messaging**:
   - The scrutiny of Audi's slogan post-scandal provides a case study in the consequences of misalignment between messaging and reality. The model can learn to evaluate the implications of corporate claims and their authenticity, enhancing its reasoning about trust and credibility in branding.

4. **Cross-Market Analysis**:
   - The global usage of the slogan across different markets allows the model to infer cultural and regional differences in branding effectiveness. This can improve its ability to reason about how marketing strategies must adapt to various consumer bases.

5. **Temporal Changes in Marketing**:
   - The evolution of Audi's slogans over time illustrates how companies adapt their messaging in response to market conditions and consumer expectations. The model can learn to reason about the dynamics of marketing strategies and their effectiveness over time.

### Conclusion

By consolidating and analyzing the extracted information, the model can significantly improve its causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities. It can better understand the interplay between branding, consumer perception, and corporate integrity, as well as the broader implications of marketing strategies in a global context. This enhanced reasoning ability can be applied to various scenarios beyond the automotive industry, making the model more versatile in its analytical capabilities.

Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence. 
To answer the following question:
"Which make of car is advertised under the slogan ""Vorsprung Durch Technik""?"

Passages:
['BULLET::::- Vorsprung durch Technik – "competitive edge through technology", used in an advertising campaign by Audi\n', 'Audi\'s corporate tagline is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning ""Progress through Technology"". The German-language tagline is used in many European countries, including the United Kingdom, and in other markets, such as Latin America, Oceania and parts of Asia including Japan. A few years ago, the North American tagline was ""Innovation through technology"", but in Canada the German tagline "Vorsprung durch Technik" was used in advertising. Since 2007, Audi has used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" in the U.S. However, since the Audi emissions testing scandal came to light in September 2015, this slogan was lambasted for being discordant with reality. In fact, just hours after disgraced Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn admitted to cheating on emissions data, an advertisement during the 2015 Primetime Emmy Awards promoted Audi\'s latest advances in low emissions technology with Kermit the Frog stating, "It\'s not that easy being green."\n', 'From 1931 Ferdinand Porsche and Zündapp developed the type 12 prototype "Auto für Jedermann" ("car for everyone"), which was the first time the name Volkswagen was used. Porsche preferred the 4-cylinder flat engine, but Zündapp used a water-cooled 5-cylinder radial engine. In 1932 three prototypes were running. All three cars were lost during the war, the last in a 1945 Stuttgart bombing raid.\n', 'Some of the advertising slogans Subaru has used in the past include: "Inexpensive, and built to stay that way" (USA 1970s – early 1980s), "The World\'s Favourite Four Wheel Drive" (in the UK), "Plus on y pense, plus on a le goût de la conduire" (Literally: "The more one thinks, the more one has the taste (or desire, impulse, drive) of driving it") in French Quebec, "We built our reputation by building a better car", "What to Drive", "The Beauty of All-Wheel Drive", "Driven by What\'s Inside", "Think, Feel, Drive", "Love. It\'s what makes Subaru, a Subaru" (USA early 2010s) and currently "Confidence in Motion" in North America, "All 4 The Driver" in Australia, "Uncommon Engineering, Uncommon Stability, Uncommon Roadholding, Uncommon Sense" in the UK and "Technology that gives you Confidence in Motion" in Southeast Asia.\n', 'BULLET::::- Audi: Vorsprung durch Technik (Literally: Advantage through technology, Figuratively: The technical edge)\n', 'On 26 May 1938, Hitler laid the cornerstone for the Volkswagen factory in Fallersleben. He gave a speech, in which he named the car "Kraft-durch-Freude-Wagen" ("Strength Through Joy Car", usually abbreviated to "KdF-Wagen"). \n', 'The Marketing Department researched their files and retrieved for the Ford P7b a slogan coined for Bahnsen’s innovatively styled 1960 Taunus P3, „Linie der Vernunft“ which loosely translates as “rational form”. This they now applied to the P7b. Now, as ten years earlier, the intention was to point up an aesthetic contrast between a newly simplified 17M model and an over-decorated predecessor.\n', 'The 1960s was a period of rapid expansion in Europe both for the auto-industry and in the world of advertising. Ford tended to be ahead of the field in this aspect of marketing, even if some of the resulting slogans appear stilted fifty years later. The style of new Taunus 17M was advertised as representing a „Linie der Vernunft" which loosely translates as a ""rational form"" offering an implicit rebuke to the by now unfashionably elaborate styling of the old Taunus 17M. The car was advertised with the balanced and pithy slogan "Zum Fahren geboren. Zum sparen gebaut" "(Born to drive. Built to save/economise)".\n', "The 919 Hybrid was liveried in white and incorporated the 'Porsche Intelligent Performance' slogan, with the first letters of each word emblazoned down the vehicle when viewed from the top. The rear wing was liveried in black with the word 'Porsche' in red letters. The team had no title sponsor, with few sponsor stickers adorning the car. Its race number was put in a red square in the middle of the top section of its sidepods and near both fenders but below both door panels. On 12\xa0June 2013, Bernhard drove the 919 Hybrid in a one-day private test session under a camouflage livery at Porsche's Weissach test track. Testing continued into September, with car development carried out at France's Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours and Circuit Paul Ricard, Italy's Autodromo Nazionale Monza and Germany's EuroSpeedway Lausitz. Its 2013 schedule concluded at Portugal's Algarve International Circuit in December.\n", 'The company name is based on the Latin translation of the surname of the founder, August Horch. "Horch", meaning "listen" in German, becomes "audi" in Latin. The four rings of the Audi logo each represent one of four car companies that banded together to create Audi\'s predecessor company, Auto Union. Audi\'s slogan is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning "Being Ahead through Technology". However, Audi USA had used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" from 2007 to 2016, and have not used the slogan since 2016. Audi, along with fellow German marques BMW and Mercedes-Benz, is among the best-selling luxury automobile brands in the world.\n']

question_info.question: "Which make of car is advertised under the slogan ""Vorsprung Durch Technik""?"
passages:
BULLET::::- Vorsprung durch Technik – "competitive edge through technology", used in an advertising campaign by Audi
Audi's corporate tagline is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning ""Progress through Technology"". The German-language tagline is used in many European countries, including the United Kingdom, and in other markets, such as Latin America, Oceania and parts of Asia including Japan. A few years ago, the North American tagline was ""Innovation through technology"", but in Canada the German tagline "Vorsprung durch Technik" was used in advertising. Since 2007, Audi has used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" in the U.S. However, since the Audi emissions testing scandal came to light in September 2015, this slogan was lambasted for being discordant with reality. In fact, just hours after disgraced Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn admitted to cheating on emissions data, an advertisement during the 2015 Primetime Emmy Awards promoted Audi's latest advances in low emissions technology with Kermit the Frog stating, "It's not that easy being green."
From 1931 Ferdinand Porsche and Zündapp developed the type 12 prototype "Auto für Jedermann" ("car for everyone"), which was the first time the name Volkswagen was used. Porsche preferred the 4-cylinder flat engine, but Zündapp used a water-cooled 5-cylinder radial engine. In 1932 three prototypes were running. All three cars were lost during the war, the last in a 1945 Stuttgart bombing raid.
Some of the advertising slogans Subaru has used in the past include: "Inexpensive, and built to stay that way" (USA 1970s – early 1980s), "The World's Favourite Four Wheel Drive" (in the UK), "Plus on y pense, plus on a le goût de la conduire" (Literally: "The more one thinks, the more one has the taste (or desire, impulse, drive) of driving it") in French Quebec, "We built our reputation by building a better car", "What to Drive", "The Beauty of All-Wheel Drive", "Driven by What's Inside", "Think, Feel, Drive", "Love. It's what makes Subaru, a Subaru" (USA early 2010s) and currently "Confidence in Motion" in North America, "All 4 The Driver" in Australia, "Uncommon Engineering, Uncommon Stability, Uncommon Roadholding, Uncommon Sense" in the UK and "Technology that gives you Confidence in Motion" in Southeast Asia.
BULLET::::- Audi: Vorsprung durch Technik (Literally: Advantage through technology, Figuratively: The technical edge)
On 26 May 1938, Hitler laid the cornerstone for the Volkswagen factory in Fallersleben. He gave a speech, in which he named the car "Kraft-durch-Freude-Wagen" ("Strength Through Joy Car", usually abbreviated to "KdF-Wagen"). 
The Marketing Department researched their files and retrieved for the Ford P7b a slogan coined for Bahnsen’s innovatively styled 1960 Taunus P3, „Linie der Vernunft“ which loosely translates as “rational form”. This they now applied to the P7b. Now, as ten years earlier, the intention was to point up an aesthetic contrast between a newly simplified 17M model and an over-decorated predecessor.
The 1960s was a period of rapid expansion in Europe both for the auto-industry and in the world of advertising. Ford tended to be ahead of the field in this aspect of marketing, even if some of the resulting slogans appear stilted fifty years later. The style of new Taunus 17M was advertised as representing a „Linie der Vernunft" which loosely translates as a ""rational form"" offering an implicit rebuke to the by now unfashionably elaborate styling of the old Taunus 17M. The car was advertised with the balanced and pithy slogan "Zum Fahren geboren. Zum sparen gebaut" "(Born to drive. Built to save/economise)".
The 919 Hybrid was liveried in white and incorporated the 'Porsche Intelligent Performance' slogan, with the first letters of each word emblazoned down the vehicle when viewed from the top. The rear wing was liveried in black with the word 'Porsche' in red letters. The team had no title sponsor, with few sponsor stickers adorning the car. Its race number was put in a red square in the middle of the top section of its sidepods and near both fenders but below both door panels. On 12 June 2013, Bernhard drove the 919 Hybrid in a one-day private test session under a camouflage livery at Porsche's Weissach test track. Testing continued into September, with car development carried out at France's Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours and Circuit Paul Ricard, Italy's Autodromo Nazionale Monza and Germany's EuroSpeedway Lausitz. Its 2013 schedule concluded at Portugal's Algarve International Circuit in December.
The company name is based on the Latin translation of the surname of the founder, August Horch. "Horch", meaning "listen" in German, becomes "audi" in Latin. The four rings of the Audi logo each represent one of four car companies that banded together to create Audi's predecessor company, Auto Union. Audi's slogan is "Vorsprung durch Technik", meaning "Being Ahead through Technology". However, Audi USA had used the slogan "Truth in Engineering" from 2007 to 2016, and have not used the slogan since 2016. Audi, along with fellow German marques BMW and Mercedes-Benz, is among the best-selling luxury automobile brands in the world.
